title: FOUR TWENTY
objective: Four Twenty moves the entire in-store dispensary experience online.

content_data._details:
With the legalization of marijuana across the United States and Canada, more people are getting out of their comfort zones and trying cannabis products to help with anxiety, depression, or even just boost their mood and creativity.

 I spent 15 weeks to ideate, research, test, and design an app that moves the entire in-store dispensary experience online. Users can take the quiz and get personal recommendations to find the right cannabis.

 Four Twenty is designed for newcomers to learn and discover, and offers experienced users a platform to explore different varieties of cannabis.

title: JAZZIN
objective: Jazzin is a 3-day jazz festival supporting local jazz bars and artists to raise awareness of their groups to the public.

content_data.category:
Branding
Social Media Strategy
Digital Product Design
content_data.deliverables:
Brand System
Poster
Social Media Campaign
Landing Website
Mobile App

content.content_data: I was leading the design and strategy of the social media campaign, designing several interfaces for mobile application as well as working closely with the team, supporting, exchanging ideas and contributing creativity with my fellow designers.

title: FOCUSED.
objective: Focused helps drivers stay focused on the road by eliminating distractions on their mobile phones.

content_data._details: As a road-trip enthusiast, I’m aware of the seriousness and the consequences of distracted driving(like text-and-drive). Focused is a mobile experience that reduces user engagement and aims to save lives.

content_data.quote0: "1/4 car accidents is caused by texting and driving"
content_data.quote1: "Text & drive is 6x more likely to cause an accident than DUI"
content_data.quote2: "94% of teen drivers acknowledge the dangers of text & drive, but 35% admitted to doing it anyway"
content_data.text:
Looking at these numbers, I couldn’t stop thinking about what are the possible ways to keep drivers away from their phones.

I started looking for existing apps or solutions that has similar features. Drivemode has similar concept, which they are aiming for integrating all kinds of apps, phone features into their product to facilitate the user engagement with their phone, could end up causing drivers spending more time engaging with their phones, which is the opposite of what I want to achieve.

With the rising phenomena of nomophobia(no-mobile-phone phobia) among population, smart phones are becoming more and more addictive, users could be checking their phone subconsciously, so I decided to use some “hard-core“ design to stop this addiction.

I ran through the knowledge I have in software engineering, found a feature which can be used by developers called the single application mode, which allows the phone to lock on specific apps, the user cannot see incoming notifications or go back to the home screen and open another app.

I could apply this technology into this product, so the users have less chance to get distracted by their phones.

content_data.text0:
To encourage users/drivers to use Focused, I decided to use gamification by integrating a social system, a reward system and a map diary into this product. However, due to the time limit, I could not finish designing the medals for the reward system; which the reward system eventually get dropped from the features of the app.

To further reducing user engagement while driving, I decided to incorporate color saturation with traveling speed, the screen will become less saturated with colors when the vehicle is traveling faster.
After making my thoughts clear and figuring out what the direction and the flow of this product’s experience, I came up with the wireframes (low-fidelity prototype).

title: αPARK
objective: αPark connects drivers looking for parking with parking space owners and businesses.

content_data._details: Finding parking has not always been easy. Inspired by business models such as that of Airbnb, which connects home owners with travels, I designed a similar experience in response to the parking problem.

content_data.text0: Before diving into the actual design process, I started by looking for existing apps or solutions that have similar features. Pavemint and ParqEx are two products that matched my idea. However, these apps suffer from a challenging user experience, with an interface that is often confusing to users. That’s why I decided to research and target existing problems in order to enhance the user experience of my product.
content_data.desc0: For instance, ParqEx has a really small date and time picker, comparing to the size of the screen, which could leads users to select the wrong date or time
content_data.text1_0: After conducting interviews with potential users in person, I summarized the results into these points:
content_data.points1:
- All expressed the need for this specific product
- The distance from the parking spot to the destination is the most important factor for users
- Some users would pay more for a closer parking spot to their destination
- Most of the users usually don’t look at reviews to find parking
content_data.text1_1: These points helped me to understand what users need the most, and what features should I prioritize in my product experience.

content_data.text0: After doing the researching, I started brainstorming, then created persona to assist me understand more about what I should be designing. Also, I made user flows based on the persona I created, to have a better understanding of the structure and experience of this application.

title: YINTECH LABS
objective: Design and develop digital products from start to end.

content_data.category:
Digital Product Design
Front-end Development
Back-end Development
iOS Development
content_data.collaborators: Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Back-end Developers
content_data.deliverables:
Landing Website
Stock Model Training Web Application
Mobile App
content_data._details: Worked at a machine learning and big data lab under an investment company as a UX Engineer, where I led the design and developed several projects from start to end. Updated the design of the landing website, and increased the number of the visitors by 273% compared to the previous design.

content_data.text0:
The previous Yintech Innovation Labs website was an adequate, yet older website made by an engineer using Wix. I have been requested to update the old design to a more modern, clean, aesthetically pleasing, and responsive website.

Since the theme of the website is business and finance, I picked one color as the primary color to maintain a clean and clear interface. I then resorted to the use of several images to convey the spirit of Yintech Innovation Labs. The choice of blue is because the parent company has chosen blue and orange as its primary colors. The blue color I chose is a variation of the blue color from the parent company so it represents the relationship and connections between these two companies, but also their status as distinct entities.
